communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Shawn Bovee
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records mentioning or describing Shawn Bovee.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Molly Fisher

09/19/2023

Muckrock News
& Ms. Molly Fisher

Dear Ms. Fisher,

We have received your California Public Records Act request dated 9/14/2023 via email.  In your request you ask for records regarding Mr. Shawn Bovee.  I have completed a search on our Records Management System going back for a period of 5 years and I have located the following responsive records to your request.

07/31/2023          Meet with Community Services Officer at the station.          Disposition: completed
06/12/2023          Meet with Officer at the station.          Disposition: completed
03/28/2023          Meet with Community Services Officer at the station.         Disposition: assisted
12/31/2022          Reporting party advises resident came out and yelled at him and kicked his vehicle as he was   making a delivery.          Disposition: resolved
12/24/2022          Citizen reports violations of business regulations at Cloverdale Wellness, after disagreement regarding the school board petition.         Disposition:  advice given
06/02/2022          Citizen requests to meet the Lieutenant at the sawmill.          Disposition: completed
04/28/2022          Caller requests to leave a voicemail message for the Lieutenant          Disposition:  assisted
07/08/2020          Officer out with subject who was picking up debris from the roadway.          Disposition: completed
05/25/2020          Caller reports having a dispute with business partner.          Disposition: completed
10/14/2019          Caller requests to speak with officer regarding suspicious incident that occurred last night at Quonset Botanicals.          Disposition: report taken
05/28/2019          Citizen in the lobby to speak with Community Services Officer.          Disposition: completed
04/25/2019          Citizen reports male subject highly HBD, blue shirt, blue jeans.          Disposition: completed
03/25/2019          Officer investigates incident reported by school board member, of juveniles illegally working to trim marijuana.            Disposition: Alleged incident involves a third-hand 
                                 unsubstantiated report of a misdemeanor, with no identifiable victims, that reportedly occurred over a year and a half ago and is beyond statutory limitations for prosecution. 
                                 Results unfounded.
01/22/2019          Citizen requests officers assistance to identify subject in need so that he can provide transportation services out of town.      

This concludes our response to your California Public Records Act Request dated September 14, 2023.  Please feel free to contact me directly if you should have any questions regarding this information.  

Sincerely,

Linda Webb
Custodian of Records
Cloverdale Police Department

09/19/2023 15:24 HOURS
MUCKROCK NEWS
& MOLLY FISHER

I would like to update my response to your PRA request.  Unfortunately your request came in while I was away on vacation, in my haste to respond I mistakenly provided information that you are not entitled to.  I request that you delete my previous response to you California Public Records Act Request.

Per Government Code Section 7923.600 -7923.615, you are only entitled to 1 year of arrest information, to which there is none for Mr. Bovee and calls for service to a specific address.  You sent a blanket form requesting all information in error.  Again I request that you do not use any of the previous information provided to your office in error.

This completes the Cloverdale Police Departments response to your CPRA request.

Sincerely,

Linda Webb
Custodian of Records
Police Records Manager
Cloverdale Police Department

1.	 Smedley Rue LLC (Schmaltz)       386.00

  SHALANDA M.J. MILLER 
 OFFICIAL CUSTODIAN OF RECORDS

September 18, 2023 
SENT VIA EMAIL: 
Dear Andrew Free: 
This correspondence is in response to your Open Records Act Request Reference#: R003976-060523 dated June 05, 2023.  Your request sought the following: To Whom It May Concern:The requested information has been uploaded to the portal. The following information has been redacted: 

Pursuant to the Georgia Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records: 

All logs of open records requests received by your office from January 1, 2023 to the present. 

Thank you! 
The document(s) or portions of the document(s) include social security number, mother's birth name, day and month of birth, bank account information, account or utility account passwords and numbers, credit/debit card information, unlisted phone number, insurance information or medical information and may not be required to be released except in limited situations defined by law. See O.C.G.A. § 50-18-72(a) (20). The document(s) or portions of the document(s) would reveal the home address, home telephone number, social security number, insurance information or medical information, or identity of immediate family member or dependent of a public employee.  See O.C.G.A. § 50-18-72(a)(21). 
Sincerely, 
Open Records Team

title: FY 2023 SNAP Fraud Framework Grant Applications

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: FY 2023 SNAP Fraud Framework Grant Applications
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All grant proposals submitted for the FY 2023 SNAP Fraud Framework Implementation Grant program. This program was opened to applicants on April 5, 2023 and closed on June 4, 2023 so I expect all responsive records to be dated within that time frame.

Responsive documents may include but are not limited to the following forms, according to the announcement for the grant :(https://www.fns.usda.gov/grant/snap-fraud-framework-implementation). 

SF-424 – Application for Federal Assistance 
SF-424A – Budget Information and Instruction Form 
SF-424B – Assurances for Non-Construction Programs 
SF-LLL – Disclosure of Lobbying Activities 
FNS-906 – Grant Program Accounting System & Financial Capability Questionnaire
Negotiated Indirect Cost Rate Agreement 

Documents may also include powerpoints, PDFs, word docs and other proposal materials.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Tonya Riley

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Harris Wofford, FBI file
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

A copy of all documents or FBI files pertaining to Harris Wofford, an obituary of whom was published in The New York Times on January 22, 2019 under the headline "Harris Wofford, 92, Ex-Senator Who Pushed Volunteerism, Is Dead". Please see attached PDF copy of that obituary, which may also be found at https://www.nytimes.com/2019/01/22/us/politics/harris-wofford-dead.html.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Parker Higgins, FOIA The Dead

Please be advised that efoia@subscriptions.fbi.gov is a no-reply email
address. Questions regarding your FOIA request may be directed to
foipaquestions@fbi.gov. If you have received a FOIPA request number, please
include this in all correspondence concerning your request. Please note eFOIPA
requests are processed in the order that they are received. If you have not
received a FOIPA request number, your request is in the process of being
opened at which time it will be assigned a FOIPA request number and
correspondence will be forthcoming.

** 

Upon receipt of your FOIPA request number, you may check the status of your
FOIPA request on the FBI’s electronic FOIA Library (The Vault) on the FBI’s
public website, http://vault.fbi.gov by clicking on the ‘Check Status of Your
FOI/PA Request tool’ link. Status updates are performed on a weekly basis. If
you receive a comment that your FOIPA request number was not located in the
database, please check back at a later date.

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request: Harris Wofford, FBI file
communications.communication:
Thank you for contacting foipaquestions@fbi.gov.  Please check the status of your FOIPA Request at http://vault.fbi.gov by clicking on "Check Status of Your FOI/PA Request" on the right side of the page, and follow the instructions below.

Check the Status of Your FOIPA Request
If your FOIPA Number is [1234567-0] please enter [1234567-000] into the system. If your FOIPA Number is [1234567-1] please enter [1234567-001] into the system. If you have any questions about the status of your FOIPA request, please e-mail foipaquestions@ic.fbi.gov.

FIND STATUS OF FOIPA- Request statuses are updated weekly

Please enter the whole FOIPA number-Example: [1234567-000]

FOIPA:
Results will show the Request Number, Case Type and Process Description shown below:
FOIPA:
1234567-000

Case Type:
FOIPA

Process Description (Will display the current progress of the request)
The FBI's FOIPA Program is searching the FBI's indices for potentially responsive documents.
You may be contacted via formal letter for all fees and/or negotiation issues that may apply.

NOTE: Recent requests are entered into the FOIPA database in the order that they are received. Before you can check the status, you must have received correspondence assigning a FOIPA request number and the information transferred to the online database. Status information is updated weekly. If a request has been closed within the last six months the online database will display the following: The FOIPA number entered has been closed, and appropriate correspondence has been sent to the address on file.

Estimated Dates of Completion
Requests are processed in the order in which they are received through our multi-track processing system.  Requests are divided into two primary tracks--simple (under 50 pages of potentially responsive documents) and complex (over 50 pages of potentially responsive documents).  Complex requests are further divided into medium, large, and extra-large sub-tracks based upon request size.  Simple track requests typically require the least amount of time to process.  Currently, simple track cases average approximately 138 days from the date of receipt for processing.  Our complex requests in the medium processing track are currently averaging 571 days, large processing track are currently averaging approximately 1,289 days, and extra-large processing track are currently averaging 1,649 days for processing.

Respectfully,

Public Information Officer
Record/Information Dissemination Section (RIDS) FBI-Information Management Division
170 Marcel Drive, Winchester, VA 22602-4843
Direct: (540) 868-4593
Fax: (540) 868-4391
Questions E-mail: foipaquestions@fbi.gov<mailto:foipaquestions@fbi.gov>

Do you have further questions about the FOI/PA process? Visit us at http://www.fbi.gov/foia

Please check the status of your request online at https://vault.fbi.gov/fdps-1/@@search-fdps    Status updates are performed on a weekly basis.

Note:  This is a non-emergency email address.  If this is an emergency, please call 911 directly.  If you need to report a tip for immediate action, please contact FBI Tips at http://tips.fbi.gov/ or reach out to your local field office.

Pursuant to (O.C.G.A.) §§ 50-18-70 through 50-18-76 I would like to request any and all known records of Troy Everett Ogletree DOB 04/04/1988 to include any records that list him as a witness, suspect, victim, complainant, person of interest or informant. Any contact cards, or any other electronic or tangible document as it relates to the above referenced individual.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kai Jun Hana

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Bresett Disciplinary Records
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

The complete disciplinary records of corrections officers Christopher J. Bresett, Gregory J. Bresett, and Gregory M. Bresett.

Citing the FOIL Subject Matter List of the Department of Corrections and Community Supervision last known to be updated February 16, 2021, the record would be listed under subheading "EMPLOYEE SUBJECTS" where this describes the following described records:

* Employee Investigations
* Executive Facility Files
* Human Resources/Personnel
* Labor Relations

Per legislation signed by the Governor on June 12, 2020, as Chapter 96 of the New York State Laws of 2020, these are now subject to release upon request through the state's Freedom of Information Law; records may not be withheld citing New York State Civil Rights Law 50-a (repealed).

Explicitly releasable are records including:

* complaints, allegations, and charges;
* the name of the employee complained of or charged;
* the transcript of any disciplinary trial or hearing, including any exhibits introduced at such trial or hearing;
* the disposition of any disciplinary proceeding;
* the final written opinion or memorandum supporting the disposition and discipline imposed including the agency's complete factual findings and its analysis of the conduct and appropriate discipline of the covered employee.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Chris Gelardi

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Vincent Louis Gigante  FOIA  FBI
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All Records/Files  relating to or mentioning Vincent Louis Gigante . date of birth March 29, 1928.  Date of death December 19, 2005 .  Mr Gigante was boss of Genovese family.
In 1997, Vincent Gigante was convicted of racketeering and conspiracy charges.  http://articles.latimes.com/1997/dec/19/news/mn-200
Mr Gigante died at United States Medical Center for Federal Prisoners - Springfield, Missouri.

News of passing has been publicly reported thru national media news organization:  https://www.nytimes.com/2005/12/24/nyregion/gigante-mafia-boss-is-mourned-and-buried-with-little-fanfare.html
https://www.seattletimes.com/seattle-news/obituaries/vincent-gigante-dies-was-last-great-mafioso/
https://www.nytimes.com/2005/12/19/obituaries/vincent-gigante-mafia-leader-who-feigned-insanity-dies-at-77.html
Per FBI standards and regulations, this is acceptable proof of death.

Please conduct a search of the Central Records System, including but not limited to the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices, the Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, and the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices, for both main-file records and cross-reference records for all relevant names, individuals, agencies and companies. 

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public interest. The requested documents will be processed by a representative of the news media/press.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Eric Bradley

    Per FBI standards and regulations, this is acceptable proof of death.
    
    Please conduct a search of the Central Records System, including but not
    limited to the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices, the Microphone
    Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, and
    the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices, for both main-file records and

    companies.
    
    I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as I believe this

    this request is not being made for commercial purposes.
    
    In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me
    of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the
    request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM
    if not.
    
    Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look
    forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days,
    as the statute requires.
    
    Sincerely,
    
    Eric Bradley
    
    Upload documents directly:
    https://www.muckrock.com/accounts/agency_login/federal-bureau-of-investigation-10/vincent-louis-gigante-foia-fbi-66338/?uuid-login=da61d9fe-7f1a-42e8-893f-2fd5163f06e4&email=foipaquestions%40ic.fbi.gov#agency-reply

Supporting documentation **

Please be advised that efoia@subscriptions.fbi.gov is a no-reply email
address. Questions regarding your FOIA request may be directed to
foipaquestions@fbi.gov. If you have received a FOIPA request number, please
include this in all correspondence concerning your request. Please note eFOIPA
requests are processed in the order that they are received. If you have not
received a FOIPA request number, your request is in the process of being
opened at which time it will be assigned a FOIPA request number and
correspondence will be forthcoming.

** 

Upon receipt of your FOIPA request number, you may check the status of your
FOIPA request on the FBI’s electronic FOIA Library (The Vault) on the FBI’s
public website, http://vault.fbi.gov by clicking on the ‘Check Status of Your
FOI/PA Request tool’ link. Status updates are performed on a weekly basis. If
you receive a comment that your FOIPA request number was not located in the
database, please check back at a later date.

title: Remainder of NSA June 8, 1967 Intercepts of Israeli Helo Pilot Conversations and other 6/8/67 Intercepts

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Remainder of NSA June 8, 1967 Intercepts of Israeli Helo Pilot Conversations and other 6/8/67 Intercepts
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I was aboard the USS Liberty when the ship was attacked by the IDF on June 8, 1967 and serve my shipmates as Director of Operations of the USS Liberty Veterans Association.

The NSA has released brief snippets of intercepts from June 8, 1967 of recordings of IDF helicopter pilots as they approached the USS Liberty after the attack was over.

See:

https://media.defense.gov/2021/Jul/18/2002804895/-1/-1/1/201203-D-IM742-2023.MP3

https://media.defense.gov/2021/Jul/18/2002804894/-1/-1/1/201203-D-IM742-2024.MP3

https://media.defense.gov/2021/Jul/18/2002804893/-1/-1/1/201203-D-IM742-2025.MP3

We are requesting the NSA to release the remainder of the intercepts that include these snippets and any other intercepts recorded on June 8, 1967 related to Sixth Fleet activity or the attack on the USS Liberty or received from USS Liberty crewmen following the attack.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Joe Meadors

communications.subject: RE: [URL Verdict: Neutral][Non-DoD Source] RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #115439
communications.communication:
Dear Joe Meadors:
We received your inquiry for a status update on your case (115439).  The NSA Freedom of Information Act (FOIA)/Privacy Act (PA) divison treats all FOIA and PA requesters fairly by responding to each on a first-in, first-out basis in accordance with federal regulations.  Each request is unique; as such, there is no set timeframe for this process.
Your case is assigned to an initial processing case officer and the search for responsive documents is in progress for this request.  A letter will be sent from the NSA FOIA/PA division once the search is complete.  Please be advised that each case that has responsive records goes through three levels of review prior to the final response.  The length of review in each phase depends on many factors, such as the number of pages and classification level.
NSA Freedom of Information Division
(301) 688-6527

title: Complaints and Case Files, Nicotine Poisoning, 1990-2022 (Occupational Safety & Health Administration (OSHA), Connecticut (Region I))

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Complaints and Case Files, Nicotine Poisoning, 1990-2022 (Occupational Safety & Health Administration (OSHA), Connecticut (Region I))
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All health and safety related case files and complaints on behalf of tobacco farmworkers that include the phrase,"nicotine poisoning," spanning January 1990 - June 2022 (or the latest date available).

This will be published by the national outlet Civil Eats with funding from Berkeley Journalism School.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Greta Moran

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: FOIA Request: Inspection Reports and Citations for Tobacco Worker Complaints (Department of Labor)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

To whom it may concern, 

I would like to request the inspection reports and any citations for the following complaints filed by tobacco farmworkers to the Department of Labor’s Occupational Safety and Health Administration. 

-UPA# F-1652858, Polek Brothers Tobacco, LLC, UPA Receipt Date 08/31/2020, Inspection Report #1491322
-UPA# F-1634336, J-J Thompson Farms, Inc., UPA Receipt Date 07/27/2020, Inspection Report #1485657
-UPA# F-1788300, Derek Smith Farms, UPA Receipt Date 07/17/2021, Inspection Report #1543120
-UPA# F-1805387, J-J Thompson Farms, Inc., UPA Receipt Date, 08/30//2021, Inspection Report #1551430
-UPA# R-1473394, RICH FARMS, INC., UPA Receipt Date 07/08/2019, Inspection Report #1414909
-UPA# R-1796330, Horace Randy Wood, UPA Receipt Date 08/10/2021

I am a journalist with Civil Eats, and this will be used to further my reporting on health and safety issues pertaining to farmworkers.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Grey Moran

title: FBI Documents Related to Surveillance of Black Lives Matter and Related Groups

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: FBI Documents Related to Surveillance of Black Lives Matter and Related Groups
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting access to documents related to the FBI's surveillance or investigation of Black Lives Matter and other related groups. In order to ensure a comprehensive search for responsive records, I am requesting an interagency search for any records that may be held by other law enforcement agencies or government entities.

I would also like to reference the Brennan Center's report entitled "FBI Targets a New Generation of Black Activists," published on September 13, 2017, which highlights the FBI's targeting of Black activists. I will be attaching the article for your reference.

Specifically, I am seeking any records, reports, memoranda, emails, or other documents related to the FBI's surveillance or investigation of Black Lives Matter, including any policies, guidelines, or procedures related to this surveillance or investigation. I am also requesting any communications between the FBI and other law enforcement agencies or government entities related to the surveillance or investigation of Black Lives Matter.

Additionally, I am interested in any records, reports, memoranda, emails, or other documents related to the FBI's surveillance or investigation of any groups or individuals associated with Black Lives Matter or involved in activism related to racial justice, police reform, or other related issues. This may include but is not limited to groups such as the Movement for Black Lives, Campaign Zero, and the National Association for the Advancement of Colored People (NAACP).

I want to emphasize that I do not consent to the withholding, deletion, or redaction of any responsive records or documents, except in cases where the FBI or any other agency can provide a specific justification for why the records are exempt from disclosure under the Freedom of Information Act. Please provide me with any non-exempt records or documents in their entirety, including any segregable portions that may be released.

I hereby provide notice that any attempt to withhold, redact, or delete responsive records or documents without providing a specific justification for why they are exempt from disclosure will be met with a complaint and legal action to compel the FBI or any other agency to provide access to the requested records in accordance with the Freedom of Information Act.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Good Citizen

Request Information

    2017, which highlights the FBI's targeting of Black activists. I will be
    attaching the article for your reference.
    
    Specifically, I am seeking any records, reports, memoranda, emails, or other
    documents related to the FBI's surveillance or investigation of Black Lives
    Matter, including any policies, guidelines, or procedures related to this
    surveillance or investigation. I am also requesting any communications
    between the FBI and other law enforcement agencies or government entities
    related to the surveillance or investigation of Black Lives Matter.

    groups or individuals associated with Black Lives Matter or involved in
    activism related to racial justice, police reform, or other related issues.
    This may include but is not limited to groups such as the Movement for Black
    Lives, Campaign Zero, and the National Association for the Advancement of
    Colored People (NAACP).
    
    I want to emphasize that I do not consent to the withholding, deletion, or

    Sincerely,

** 

Please be advised that efoia@subscriptions.fbi.gov is a no-reply email
address. Questions regarding your FOIA request may be directed to
foipaquestions@fbi.gov. If you have received a FOIPA request number, please
include this in all correspondence concerning your request. Please note eFOIPA

received a FOIPA request number, your request is in the process of being
opened at which time it will be assigned a FOIPA request number and

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

I am writing to appeal the response to my Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request regarding Black Lives Matter, FOIPA Request No.: 1589047-000. I am requesting that the FBI conduct a more thorough search and provide all responsive records.

In my initial request, I provided specific key terms and reference points to narrow down the search, yet the response I received stated that there was no attempt made to search for responsive records. This leads me to believe that the search was inadequate in whole, and I request that the FBI conduct a more comprehensive search.

Furthermore, I would like to request an interagency search for any responsive records that may be held by other agencies. As stated in 5 U.S.C. § 552 (a)(3)(C), agencies are required to make reasonable efforts to search for records that are requested, even if the records are not located within the agency. Given the importance and significance of the Black Lives Matter movement, I believe it is reasonable to assume that other agencies may hold responsive records.

In support of my appeal, I would like to cite the case law of Citizens for Responsibility and Ethics in Washington v. Executive Office of the President, 658 F. Supp. 2d 217, 225 (D.D.C. 2009), which held that agencies must conduct a search that is reasonably calculated to uncover all responsive documents, rather than a search that is cursory or in bad faith. Additionally, I would like to cite the legal principle of agency discretion, which provides that agencies must conduct their searches in good faith and with due diligence.

I hope that you will reconsider your response to my FOIA request and conduct a more thorough search for responsive records. If you have any questions or require any further information, please do not hesitate to contact me.

Thank you for your attention to this matter.

Sincerely,

communications.subject: North Carolina Public Records Law Request: Gastonia Police Department (NC) Social Media
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the North Carolina Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

This request seeks records relating to the Facebook located at https://www.facebook.com/GastoniaPoliceDepartment and the Twitter account located at https://twitter.com/GPDNC. An example of what each of these records look like is available at https://bit.ly/facebookfoia.

In order to access the requested information, you will first need to take the following steps:

1. Log into the page account or a Facebook account with managerial access to the Facebook page. For information on this type of access, see: https://www.facebook.com/help/187316341316631.)
2. "Switch" to the page account. To do so, click your profile photo in the top right, then click "See all profiles", then select the Page you want to switch into. (See the instructions here: https://www.facebook.com/help/123930246348340).
3. Click "Professional dashboard" on the left, or go to this URL https://www.facebook.com/GastoniaPoliceDepartment/?sk=professional_dashboard. 
I request the following information:

1. The "Page and Tagging" information. Once logged into the account, go to this URL: https://www.facebook.com/settings/?tab=timeline&privacy_source=timeline_gear_menu.

2. The list of blocked users. This information is accessible by following these steps:
(a) Once logged into the account, go to this URL: https://www.facebook.com/settings?tab=blocking
(b) Click "Edit" next to "Block users"
(c) Click "See your blocked list"

3. The list of blocked Pages. This information is accessible by following these steps:
(a) Once logged into the account, go to this URL: https://www.facebook.com/settings?tab=blocking
(b) Click "Edit" next to "Block Pages"
(c) Click "See your blocked list"

4. The list of "Moderation Assist" criteria. This information is accessible by following either of these steps:
(a) Once logged into the account, go to the "Professional Dashboard" and then click "Moderation Assist" on the left side of the screen.
(b) Alternatively, visit this URL: https://www.facebook.com/GastoniaPoliceDepartment/professional_dashboard/moderation_assist.

5. If the "Moderation Assist" criteria includes "Comment has certain keywords", the list of keywords. This information is accessible by following the steps in (4) above, then:
(a) Click the pencil (edit) icon next to each of the criteria ("Comment has certain keywords").
(b) Click "Edit" from the drop-down menu.
(c) Click "Comment has certain keywords"
(d) On the right side of the "Keywords" menu, click the ellipsis menu ("...")
(e) Click "Copy list" from the dropdown menu.
(f) Provide the information from the list.

6. If the "Moderation Assist" criteria includes "Comment has specific links", the list of keywords. This information is accessible by following the steps in (4) above, then:
(a) Click the pencil (edit) icon next to each of the criteria ("Comment has specific links").
(b) Click "Edit" from the drop-down menu.
(c) Click "Comment has links to specific sites."
(d) Provide the information from the "Added sites" list.

7. The list of people with Facebook access. From the "Professional dashboard" page (https://www.facebook.com/GastoniaPoliceDepartment/?sk=professional_dashboard), click "Page Access" on the left side of the screen. Alternatively, visit this URL: https://www.facebook.com/settings/?tab=profile_access.

8. The list of moderation actions in the Activity log. This information is accessible by following these steps:
(a) Once logged into the account, go to the "Professional Dashboard."
(b) Click "Moderation Assist" on the left side of the screen (or go to this URL: https://www.facebook.com/GastoniaPoliceDepartment/professional_dashboard/moderation_assist).
(c) Click "Activity log" on the left side of the screen (or go to this URL: https://www.facebook.com/GastoniaPoliceDepartment/professional_dashboard/moderation_activity_log).
(c) From the dropdown menu labeled "Visible comments", select "Hidden comments".
(d) Continue scrolling down until the complete list is loaded.

9. 4. For each of the "THREADS" identified below, a copy of any hidden comments, with all comments expanded, as visible when logged in as the page. The records of the hidden comments on the full thread may be accessed through this process:
(a) Once logged into the account, navigate to the url of the thread.
(b) Make sure you are interacting with the page as the page: Click the down-pointing arrow next to the user icon (located near the top of the thread, to the right of the "Like," "Comment," and "Share" buttons) and, on the "Choose How to Interact" menu, select the name of the page.
(c) Click "Most Relevant" (or "Newest" or "All Comments" or "Hidden by This Page") and, on the menu, select "Hidden by This Page".
(d) Make sure the thread is fully expanded: Scroll through the comments and click the links reading "1 reply," "replies," or "View more comments" to expand the thread.

For purposes of this request, "THREADS" means and refers to the posts located at:

(a) https://www.facebook.com/GastoniaPoliceDepartment/posts/pfbid02anJjMihNh7srUsSHNGAEqUPg8xobnVMcnBt9itKKDR7dk6Kxf9VQtdpFP8m2CCsZl
(b) https://www.facebook.com/GastoniaPoliceDepartment/posts/pfbid02Jf2jaqWNHukhPx1Mx5CR5cyHpREvbD6XaJ5TKN7nsWYr7E2SPVJeZGCf9JFppL8cl
(c) https://www.facebook.com/GastoniaPoliceDepartment/posts/pfbid02bdESrWpQbnp7DChBRjTHKVVG9Ngo7zDjZccnHF6K8pgSdvAvdms6Lc2Rr9ZHpDqGl

10. The list of blocked Twitter accounts for each of the Twitter accounts listed above. To access this information, navigate to this URL while logged into the account: https://twitter.com/settings/blocked.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Adam Steinbaugh

communications.subject: Government Records Access and Management Act Request: Police Data Collection Request (2016-2021)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Government Records Access and Management Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. the total number of use of force incidents, separated by year, from 2016-2021 (for example, 302 use of force incidents in 2016, 287 use of force incidents in 2017, etc.)

2. the total number of use of force incidents, separated by type of force, for 2021 (for example, information that specifies the number of taser incidents in 2021, baton incidents in 2021, etc.)

3. the total number of civilian complaints alleging any form of law enforcement misconduct that were reported and the total number sustained for 2021.

4. the total number of civilian complaints alleging law enforcement use of excessive force that were reported and the total number sustained for 2021.

5. the total number of civilian complaints alleging biased policing or racial profiling that were reported and the total number sustained for 2021.

6. the total number of civilian complaints alleging criminal conduct that were reported and the total number sustained for 2021.

When available, I would appreciate being sent individualized data for each item in this request in spreadsheet format. If individualized data are unavailable, please send information that includes aggregate statistics for the item instead.

Note that my requests for civilian complaints are specifically for civilian complaints alleging police misconduct, please do not include complaints filed by one officer/the department against another officer.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Samuel Sinyangwe

When available, I would appreciate being sent individualized data for each item in this request in spreadsheet format. If individualized data are unavailable, please send information that includes aggregate statistics for the item instead.

Note that my requests for civilian complaints are specifically for civilian complaints alleging police misconduct, please do not include complaints filed by one officer/the department against another officer.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Request: Fidel Castro FBI
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

This is a request under the Freedom of Information Act.  I hereby request the following records:

Previously unreleased records on Fidel Castro, whose death has been widely reported. http://www.bbc.com/news/world-latin-america-38114953

Please conduct a search of the Central Records System, including but not limited to the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices, the Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, and the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices, for both main-file records and cross-reference records for all relevant names, individuals, agencies and companies. Please search both HQ records as well as all field offices and resident agencies in Florida, Texas and California.

I am a member of the news media and request classification as such. I have previously written about the Bureau for AND Magazine, MuckRock and Glomar Disclosure. My articles have been widely read, with some reaching over 100,000 readers. As such, as I have a reasonable expectation of publication and my editorial and writing skills are well established.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.


Sincerely,

Michael Best

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Request: Fidel Castro FBI
communications.communication:
Dear Mr. Best,

The FBI has received your Freedom of Information Act/Privacy (FOIPA) request and it will be forwarded to Initial Processing for review.   Your request will be processed under the provisions of FOIPA and a response will be mailed to you at a later date.

Requests for fee waivers and expedited processing will be addressed once your request has been assigned an FOIPA request number. You will receive written notification of the FBI's decision.

Information regarding the Freedom of Information Act/Privacy is available at https://www.fbi.gov<http://www.fbi.gov>/, by clicking on the SERVICES link at the top of the homepage and then click on the Freedom of Information Act/Privacy picture, or the direct link is: https://www.fbi.gov/services/records-management/foia, or by accessing the U. S. Department of Justice at https://www.justice.gov/oip.  If you require additional assistance please contact us at foipaquestions@ic.fbi.gov.

Thank you,




David P. Sobonya
Public Information Officer/GIS
Record/Information Dissemination Section (RIDS)
FBI-Records Management Division

communications.subject: RE: [EXTERNAL EMAIL] -  RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #1362429-000
communications.communication:
The FBI has received your additional correspondence regarding your Freedom of Information/Privacy Act (FOIPA) request and it has been forwarded to the assigned analyst for review and determination.

Respectfully,

Public Information Officer
FBI - Information Management Division
200 Constitution Drive
Winchester, VA  22602
O: (540) 868-4593
E: foipaquestions@fbi.gov<mailto:foipaquestions@fbi.gov>

Do you have further questions about the FOI/PA process? Visit us at http://www.fbi.gov/foia

Please check the status of your request online at https://vault.fbi.gov/fdps-1/@@search-fdps    Status updates are performed on a weekly basis.

Note:  This is a non-emergency email address.  If this is an emergency, please call 911 directly.  If you need to report a tip for immediate action, please contact FBI Tips at http://tips.fbi.gov/ or reach out to your local field office.

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: State Delays (U.S. Department of State)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

For the time period of Jan. 1, 2018, to the date of search, please provide copies of the complaint, answer, and first joint status report filed in any FOIA lawsuits against the Department of State.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Matthew Topic

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request: State Delays (U.S. Department of State)

communications.subject: F-2019-08260
communications.communication:
Mr. Topic,

This is in response to your letter dated August 14, 2019. The Office of Information Programs and Services is in receipt of your request dated July 18, 2019, and has assigned it Case Control Number F-2019-08260.  Please note that this request is in queue to be officially acknowledged and reviewed for validity.

We apologize for the delayed response.

If you have further concerns or any questions regarding any FOIA-related matter, please contact the FOIA Requester Service Center (FRSC) at 202-261-8484 or send an e-mail to foiastatus@state.gov<mailto:foiastatus@state.gov>.  Please be sure to refer to the case control number in all future inquiries concerning this request.
Regards,
Katrina M. Wood
U.S. Department of State
FOIA Requester Service

Official
UNCLASSIFIED

communications.communication:
Sir or Madam,


This is in response to the e-mail received. Your e-mail was sent to the wrong address. The Office of Information Programs and Services (IPS) at the U.S. Department of State has another e-mail address that accepts questions on FIOA cases:

foiastatus@state.gov<mailto:foiastatus@state.gov>


I hope this information is helpful. If you have further concerns or any questions regarding any FOIA-related matter, please contact the FOIA Requester Service Center (FRSC) at (202) 261-8484, or fax us at (202) 485-1669 or send an e-mail to foiastatus@state.gov<mailto:foiastatus@state.gov>
Regards,
Katrina Wood
U.S. Department of State
FOIA Requester Service Center

communications.subject: Nevada Public Records Act Request: Pizanos Pizza Health Inspection Reports
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Nevada Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All Food Establishment Inspection Reports for Pizano's Pizza, at 95 N Sierra St, Reno, NV 89501, between Jan. 1, 2021 and Sept. 11, 2023.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Patrick File

communications.subject: DC Freedom of Information Act Request: Nuisance Ordinance Information Request
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the DC Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any and all records from the past two years (August 2021-August 2023) regarding your nuisance property ordinances that will be referred to as "ordinance"  in this request but could be known (but not limited to) as "Drug-, Firearm-, or Prostitution-, Related Nuisance Abatement" as described in § 42–3101-§ 42–3114.

Please provide any and all written records (including but not limited to hard-copy documents, memos, emails, word processor documents, PDF documents, PowerPoint files, images files, video files etc.) regarding the Ordinance including but not limited to:

• any training/presentation materials used in communication, promotions, workshops, seminars, etc

• criminal background checks performed on prospective tenants

• evictions filed by property owners and number of tenants evicted as a result of the ordinance

• suspensions or revocation of a residential rental license, against property owners who fail to comply with the requirements of the ordinance 

• police calls, reports, citations, or arrests, collected by the municipality police department for the purpose of enforcing the ordinance 

• meeting minutes and correspondence between municipality officials, regarding the implementation and enforcement of the  ordinance

• all documents concerning the passage of the nuisance ordinance and any amendments to it, including communications with City elected officials, city staff, and others, and any data relied upon or reviewed as a part of the passage or amendments to the nuisance ordinance since August 2021 to August 2023.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 15 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jenny Wadhwa

communications.subject: Acknowledgement letter 2023-FOIA-08829
communications.communication:
Dear Ms./Mrs. Wadhwa, This e-mail is toacknowledge receipt of your FOIA request assigned: 2023-FOIA-08829.Your assigned FOIA Specialist is: TracyTate. 
If you have any questions regarding your request, please contact yourassigned FOIA Specialist who is included in this e-mail.  Be advised, ouroffice operates on a hybrid onsite/remote work schedule.  Therefore, ifyou are unable to reach your specialist when calling our office, please makecontact via e-mail.  For ease of reference, we ask that you have your FOIARequest Number available when you contact our office. Once the requesteddocuments are received, please be advised of the following notations below: RESPONSE TIME Pu rsuant to D.C. Official Code §2-532(c),  there is a 15 business day statutory allotted time, subject tothe possibility of a ten (10) business day extension from the date of receiptto respond to a FOIA request.  If your request is for Body Worn Camera (BWC) footage, there is a25 business day statutory allotted time, subject to the possibility of 15working-day extension from the date of receipt to respond to a Body Worn Camera (BWC) request. REQUEST FOR EXPEDITED SERVICE If you seek expedited service relating to your FOIA request,please be advised, there is no provision or authority under the District ofColumbia Freedom of Information Act laws, to provide expedited service. Therefore, your request will be processed under the provision of the D.C.Official Code §§ 2-531 et seq. Regards, Latrina Crumlin Staff Assistant Freedom of Information Act(FOIA) Office Metropolitan Police Department 300 Indiana Ave NW, RM 4153 Washington, DC 20001

communications.subject: Nevada Public Records Act Request: Yogurt Beach Inspection Reports
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Nevada Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All Food Establishment Inspection Reports for Yogurt Beach, located at 3882 Mayberry Dr B, Reno, NV 89519, from January of 2021 to December of 2023.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jennifer Kent

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: CRCL Stewart Oversight 2017-2021
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. All records created, sent, or received by CRCL before, during, or after CRCL's February 2017 on-site inspection of ICE's Stewart Detention Center in Lumpkin, GA, regarding complaints received by CRCL about ICE detainees in at Stewart.

2. All records CRCL sent to or received from the agency's subject matter experts (a medical document, a mental health expert, an environmental health and safety expert, and a corrections expert. 

3. The Expert Report Memorandum CRCL sent ICE in May 2017 following its review of Stewart, as well as the experts' written reports, and all records created or reviewed by CRCL in the drafting and approval of the Expert Report Memorandum and attachments. 

4. ICE's February 2018 response to CRCL's May 2017 memo, and all CRCL records created on or after receiving this response.

I make this request on behalf of the #DetentionKills Transparency Initiative of Al Otro Lado. 

Please note that I previously filed an identical request two years ago, to which CRCL offered no acknowledgment, tracking number, or response. 

Thank you, 

Andrew Free

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Andrew Free

communications.subject: CRCL FOIA Request 2022-CRFO-00102
communications.communication: April 25, 2022 Andrew Free MuckRock News DEPT MR 127467 411A Highland Ave Somerville, Massachusetts 02144-2516 Re: 2022-CRFO-00102 Dear Andrew Free: This acknowledges receipt of your April 17, 2022, Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request to the Department of Homeland Security (DHS) Office for Civil Rights and Civil Liberties (CRCL) and received on April 18, 2022, seeking, 1. All records created, sent, or received by CRCL before, during, or after CRCL's February 2017 on-site inspection of ICE's Stewart Detention Center in Lumpkin, GA, regarding complaints received by CRCL about ICE detainees in at Stewart. 2. All records CRCL sent to or received from the agency's subject matter experts (a medical document, a mental health expert, an environmental health and safety expert, and a corrections expert. 3. The Expert Report Memorandum CRCL sent ICE in May 2017 following its review of Stewart, as well as the experts' written reports, and all records created or reviewed by CRCL in the drafting and approval of the Expert Report Memorandum and attachments. 4. ICE's February 2018 response to CRCL's May 2017 memo, and all CRCL records created on or after receiving this response. Please note that the CRCL FOIA Office did not stand up until April 23, 2021.  Prior to that date, all FOIA requests were handled by the Privacy Office on behalf of CRCL . Therefore, CRCL did not have a FOIA contact until that date. Your request has beenassigned reference number 2022-CRFO-00102.  Noadditional information is needed at this time.  However, if anyadditional information is needed in order to complete our search for documentswe will contact you.  If you have any questions pertaining to thoserequests, please feel free to contact this office at crclfoia@hq.dhs.gov . Sincerely, CRCLFOIA Office

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #2022-CRFO-00102
communications.communication: Thank you very much for this information. Is CRCL able to provide an estimated date on which this request will be completed?

https://foiarequest.dhs.gov/ 
Sincerely, 
Department of Homeland Security

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #2022-CRFO-00102
communications.communication:
Good morning, 

Thank you very, very much for promptly responding to this request. 

We appeal the adequacy of the agency’s search and the application of Exemption 5 to what appear to be post-decisional recommendations from CRCL to ICE. As to the search, there are several CRCL complaint numbers listed in the recommendations memos that have not be produced. Nor have any communications from CRCL’s contract MH experts been provided in response to Item 2 in the request.  There also appear to be no records responsive to Item 4. 

We look forward to resolving these issues as soon as possible. Please do not hesitate to contact us should you require any additional information. 

Best regards, 

Andrew Free
#DetentionKills Transparency Initiative 
Al Otro Lado

communications.subject: Request for Additional Information 2022-CRFO-00102
communications.communication:
Good morning,

We are in receipt of an appeal you filed for Freedom of Information Act Request 2022-CRFO-00102.  In the attached appeal you stated that there was a previous appeal filed on July 7, 2022; please provide a copy of that appeal and please include the nature of the appeal if it is not iprovided.  Thank you for your assistance in helping us resolve your matter.  Please direct your correspondence direct to me at the below email address.  I look forward to hearing from you.


Respectfully,

Sharon R. Deshield
Department of Homeland Security, HQ
Office of the Secretary and Executive Management
Litigation and Appeals
Privacy Office
Email:  sharon.deshield@hq.dhs.gov<mailto:sharon.deshield@hq.dhs.gov>


"Never look down on someone...unless you are helping them up!"  Unknown

communications.subject: ICE FOIA 2022-ICFO-17052
communications.communication:
09/15/2023RE:	ICE FOIA Case Number 2022-ICFO-17052        Dear Requester:ICE's final response to your FOIA request, 2022-ICFO-17052, for 1. All records created, sent, or received by CRCL before, during, or after CRCL's February 2017 on-site inspection of ICE's Stewart Detention Center in Lumpkin, GA, regarding complaints received by CRCL about ICE detainees in at Stewart.2. All records CRCL sent to or received from the agency's subject matter experts (a medical document, a mental health expert, an environmental health and safety expert, and a corrections expert.3. The Expert Report Memorandum CRCL sent ICE in May 2017 following its review of Stewart, as well as the experts' written reports, and all records created or reviewed by CRCL in the drafting and approval of the Expert Report Memorandum and attachments.4. ICE's February 2018 response to CRCL's May 2017 memo, and all CRCL records created on or after receiving this response is attached.Sincerely,ICE FOIA OfficeImmigration and Customs EnforcementFreedom of Information Act Office500 12th Street, S.W., Stop 5009Washington, D.C. 20536-5009 
This message (including any attachments) contains confidential information intended for a specific individual and purpose, and is protected by law. If you are not the intended recipient, you should delete this message and any disclosure, copying, or distribution
 of this message, or the taking of any action based on it, by you is strictly prohibited.

communications.subject: Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: Police Data Collection Request (2020-2021)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Virginia Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. the total number of use of force incidents, separated by type of force and year used in 2020 and 2021 (for example, information that specifies the number of taser incidents in 2020, the number of taser incidents in 2021, baton incidents in 2020, baton incidents in 2021, etc.)
 
2. the total number of civilian complaints alleging any form of law enforcement misconduct that were reported and the total number sustained in 2020 and 2021.
 
3. the total number of civilian complaints alleging law enforcement use of excessive force that were reported and the total number sustained in 2020 and 2021.
 
4. the total number of civilian complaints alleging biased policing or racial profiling that were reported and the total number sustained in 2020 and 2021.
 
5. the total number of civilian complaints alleging criminal conduct that were reported and the total number sustained in 2020 and 2021.
 
6. the total number of officer involved shootings in 2020 and 2021, both fatal and non-fatal.
 
When available, I would appreciate being sent individualized data for each item in this request in spreadsheet format. If individualized data are unavailable, please send information that includes aggregate statistics for the item instead.
 
Note that my requests for civilian complaints are specifically for civilian complaints alleging police misconduct, please do not include complaints filed by one officer/the department against another officer.
The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.
 
In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.
 
Thank you.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

This request is filed by Tom Nash, a citizen of Virginia, in coordination with Samuel Sinyangwe.

communications.subject: Police Records Request :: P000982-012023
communications.communication:
Dear Tom Nash: 
Your request has been received and is being processed. Your request was received in this office on 1/19/2023 and given the reference number P000982-012023 for tracking purposes. 
 Records Requested: 1. the total number of use of force incidents, separated by type of force and year used in 2020 and 2021 (for example, information that specifies the number of taser incidents in 2020, the number of taser incidents in 2021, baton incidents in 2020, baton incidents in 2021, etc.)

2. the total number of civilian complaints alleging any form of law enforcement misconduct that were reported and the total number sustained in 2020 and 2021.

3. the total number of civilian complaints alleging law enforcement use of excessive force that were reported and the total number sustained in 2020 and 2021.

4. the total number of civilian complaints alleging biased policing or racial profiling that were reported and the total number sustained in 2020 and 2021.

5. the total number of civilian complaints alleging criminal conduct that were reported and the total number sustained in 2020 and 2021.

6. the total number of officer involved shootings in 2020 and 2021, both fatal and non-fatal.

When available, I would appreciate being sent individualized data for each item in this request in spreadsheet format. If individualized data are unavailable, please send information that includes aggregate statistics for the item instead.

Note that my requests for civilian complaints are specifically for civilian complaints alleging police misconduct, please do not include complaints filed by one officer/the department against another officer.
The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. 
You will receive a response within five working days of your request. 
You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you'll receive an email when your request has been completed. 
 
Arlington County 
To monitor the progress or update this request please log into the FOIA Center (https://u8387778.ct.sendgrid.net/ls/click?upn=6HtRfOYLt5fXvpttM-2FU1Hdd3W2qkDB0d02aZ5bZT-2FQ21OnWOZm6jOQ8hghUwLIXf6rS6fOqusZS1mn2IdmcfIXr-2Fc9fzQ-2FpKOuBpjuQmrVc-3DfsPZ_9YmvMs1Sv1-2FxVWFkBdRO6lNcIiquu19NDeRW5U1AxcezHanRpSeOu1h60LCiEOGl0TtTB5oNOogE76Bl6Atl6miFAhj91s8bzAz5Z-2F6JV1C2Dp7BzWlXxM3PW3SJ0c-2Fgn1Rqv-2Fqy36DZWRT3GeQdZxn5HJsfDN-2FwnuHH0uVCPVWofNW2viT2PC6QMCA-2BTC8drskMEEoadLXt4wFoVnyCbvcL1EpNS42gYZkvTR-2BVNBh3YmC1H71yKmfisXluaLvlFeuGSxCF1geu3-2BAEqLVKxGV58BeAuvqBGhJbdXyEzlHDNjYJ5DBliaCZ3aAApmAGVrq93Pv6i5UzmK3mPi-2FeOa0l1SvDjVzxx4i5DHzLEsJralObdaClKPi38zAVSGJmzD-2BrLPl9oScxQJMJf5aSBA-3D-3D)

communications.subject: [Records Center] Police Records Request :: P000982-012023
communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 
RE: Police Records Request of January 19, 2023, Reference # P000982-012023 Dear Tom Nash, The Arlington County Police Department received a public records request from you on January 19, 2023. Your request mentioned: 1. the total number of use of force incidents, separated by type of force and year used in 2020 and 2021 (for example, information that specifies the number of taser incidents in 2020, the number of taser incidents in 2021, baton incidents in 2020, baton incidents in 2021, etc.) 

2. the total number of civilian complaints alleging any form of law enforcement misconduct that were reported and the total number sustained in 2020 and 2021. 

3. the total number of civilian complaints alleging law enforcement use of excessive force that were reported and the total number sustained in 2020 and 2021. 

4. the total number of civilian complaints alleging biased policing or racial profiling that were reported and the total number sustained in 2020 and 2021. 

5. the total number of civilian complaints alleging criminal conduct that were reported and the total number sustained in 2020 and 2021. 

6. the total number of officer involved shootings in 2020 and 2021, both fatal and non-fatal. 

When available, I would appreciate being sent individualized data for each item in this request in spreadsheet format. If individualized data are unavailable, please send information that includes aggregate statistics for the item instead. 

Note that my requests for civilian complaints are specifically for civilian complaints alleging police misconduct, please do not include complaints filed by one officer/the department against another officer. 
The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. Pursuant to Code of Virginia § 2.2-3704(F), the County is permitted to make reasonable charges to cover the County’s actual cost incurred in accessing, duplicating, supplying, or searching for any potential responsive records.  Per your request to receive an advance cost for the request, the cost is estimated to be $50.00. Please note, these charges are for gathering the responsive records that you are seeking.  If you would like for the County to proceed with processing your request, please indicate whether you accept these charges. In the event that the County’s final costs are more; you will be billed for the difference.  In the event that the County’s final costs are less, the difference will be refunded to you. Ryan Allen 
Police Department

communications.subject: [Records Center] Police Records Request :: P000982-012023
communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 
RE: Police Records Request of January 19, 2023, Reference # P000982-012023 Dear Tom Nash, The Arlington County Police Department received a public records request from you on January 19, 2023. Your request mentioned: 1. the total number of use of force incidents, separated by type of force and year used in 2020 and 2021 (for example, information that specifies the number of taser incidents in 2020, the number of taser incidents in 2021, baton incidents in 2020, baton incidents in 2021, etc.) 

2. the total number of civilian complaints alleging any form of law enforcement misconduct that were reported and the total number sustained in 2020 and 2021. 

3. the total number of civilian complaints alleging law enforcement use of excessive force that were reported and the total number sustained in 2020 and 2021. 

4. the total number of civilian complaints alleging biased policing or racial profiling that were reported and the total number sustained in 2020 and 2021. 

5. the total number of civilian complaints alleging criminal conduct that were reported and the total number sustained in 2020 and 2021. 

6. the total number of officer involved shootings in 2020 and 2021, both fatal and non-fatal. 

When available, I would appreciate being sent individualized data for each item in this request in spreadsheet format. If individualized data are unavailable, please send information that includes aggregate statistics for the item instead. 

Note that my requests for civilian complaints are specifically for civilian complaints alleging police misconduct, please do not include complaints filed by one officer/the department against another officer. 
The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. The Police Department has reviewed its files and has located responsive records to your request. Please log in to the FOIA Center at the following link to retrieve the responsive records. Police Records Request - P000982-012023  Additionally, I have included our ACPD annual report which includes statistics that fulfill your request.  This attachment is also on our website at the following link. Publications – Official Website of Arlington County Virginia Government (arlingtonva.us) For questions or additional information, please reply to this email. Sincerely, Lieutenant Ryan Allen 
Arlington County Police Department

title: Aggregated Data from Annual Financial Reports of Cemetery Corporations

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Aggregated Data from Annual Financial Reports of Cemetery Corporations
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

RE: Division of Cemeteries

Pursuant to the New York State Freedom of Information Law (Public Officers Law §87 et seq.), I am requesting access to or a copy of the aggregated data and/or database records from the annual financial reports submitted by cemetery corporations.

In particular, I am interested in the following parts of the reports:

1. Parts 1-3 of the Annual Financial Report of Cemetery Corporation (all cemeteries must complete Parts 1-3).
2. Part 4 of the Annual Financial Report of Cemetery Corporation, including Perpetual Care Reconciliation and PM Loans.
3 .Part 5 of the Annual Financial Report of Cemetery Corporation, including Pre-Need and Installment Sales.
4. Schedule A (2136-f).
5. Schedule B (2133-f).
6. Schedule C (2079).
If there are any fees involved in the process of retrieving these records, please inform me in advance. If some of this information is exempt from release, please release as much as possible under the law.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jackson Parker

communications.subject: DOS FOIL Follow Up
communications.communication:
Dear Jackson Parker,



This message is in regard to your DOS-23-06-086, Freedom of Information Law (FOIL) inquiry regarding "Aggregated Data from Annual Financial Reports of Cemetery Corporations".


In keeping with the spirit of open government embodied in FOIL, the Department is committed to being as responsive to your request as possible. However, it is noted that your request does not specify a time period within which you would like the Department to confine its search.  We respectfully request that you provide a date range for the records you seek.  Doing so will assist us in providing a more prompt response to your request.  If further instruction or correspondence is not received within thirty (30) calendar days, the Department will deem the request to have been withdrawn.

Sincerely,

Records Access Office
New York State Department of State

title: Open Records Request: Ohio Violent Crime Reduction Grant

communications.subject: Ohio Open Records Law Request: Open Records Request: Ohio Violent Crime Reduction Grant
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

According to a press release from Gov. Mike DeWine's office, the Medina County Sheriff received a grant of $53,500 as part of the Ohio Violent Crime Reduction Grant program: https://content.govdelivery.com/attachments/OHIOGOVERNOR/2023/02/22/file_attachments/2416264/Violent%20Crime%20Reduction%20Program%20Grant%20Summaries%20through%20R12.pdf

Pursuant to the Ohio Open Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

A copy of all documents, including but not limited to, applications, agreements, and reporting documents for the Medina County Sheriff's grant of $53,500 as part of the Ohio Violent Crime Reduction Grant program described in the press release linked above.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.
